verses.kjv: And the sons of the prophets said unto Elisha, Behold now, the place where we dwell with thee is too strait for us.
verses.web: The sons of the prophets said to Elisha, “See now, the place where we live and meet with you is too small for us.
verses.ct: The sons of the prophets said to Elisha, "Look, the place where we meet with you is too small for us."

verses.kjv: Let us go, we pray thee, unto Jordan, and take thence every man a beam, and let us make us a place there, where we may dwell. And he answered, Go ye.
verses.web: Please let us go to the Jordan, and each man take a beam from there, and let’s make us a place there, where we may live.” He answered, “Go!”
verses.ct: "Please let us go to the Jordan, where each of us can cut a beam and build a new place to live." Elisha replied, "Go ahead."

verses.kjv: And one said, Be content, I pray thee, and go with thy servants. And he answered, I will go.
verses.web: One said, “Please be pleased to go with your servants.” He answered, “I will go.”
verses.ct: One of them said, "Please, come with us." He answered, "I will."

verses.kjv: So he went with them. And when they came to Jordan, they cut down wood.
verses.web: So he went with them. When they came to the Jordan, they cut down wood.
verses.ct: So he went with them. When they reached the Jordan, they began cutting down trees.

verses.kjv: But as one was felling a beam, the axe head fell into the water: and he cried, and said, Alas, master! for it was borrowed.
verses.web: But as one was cutting down a tree, the ax head fell into the water. Then he cried, and said, “Alas, my master! For it was borrowed.”
verses.ct: But as one of them was chopping a beam, the iron axe head flew off and fell into the water. He cried out, "Oh no, master! It was borrowed!"

verses.kjv: And the man of God said, Where fell it? And he shewed him the place. And he cut down a stick, and cast it in thither; and the iron did swim.
verses.web: The man of God asked, “Where did it fall?” He showed him the place. He cut down a stick, threw it in there, and made the iron float.
verses.ct: The man of God asked, "Where did it fall?" The man showed him the spot. Elisha cut a stick, threw it into the water, and the iron axe head floated to the surface.

verses.kjv: Therefore said he, Take it up to thee. And he put out his hand, and took it.
verses.web: He said, “Take it.” So he put out his hand and took it.
verses.ct: "Pick it up," Elisha said. So the man reached out and grabbed it.

verses.kjv: Then the king of Syria warred against Israel, and took counsel with his servants, saying, In such and such a place shall be my camp.
verses.web: Now the king of Syria was at war against Israel; and he took counsel with his servants, saying, “My camp will be in such and such a place.”
verses.ct: Now the king of Syria was at war with Israel. He met with his officers and said, "I'm going to set up camp at such and such a place."

verses.kjv: And the man of God sent unto the king of Israel, saying, Beware that thou pass not such a place; for thither the Syrians are come down.
verses.web: The man of God sent to the king of Israel, saying, “Beware that you not pass this place; for the Syrians are coming down there.”
verses.ct: But the man of God sent word to the king of Israel: "Be careful not to go near that area, because the Syrians are heading there."

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel sent to the place which the man of God told him and warned him of, and saved himself there, not once nor twice.
verses.web: The king of Israel sent to the place which the man of God told him and warned him of; and he saved himself there, not once or twice.
verses.ct: So the king of Israel sent scouts to the location Elisha had warned him about, and he avoided the danger — not just once or twice, but repeatedly.

verses.kjv: Therefore the heart of the king of Syria was sore troubled for this thing; and he called his servants, and said unto them, Will ye not shew me which of us is for the king of Israel?
verses.web: The king of Syria’s heart was very troubled about this. He called his servants, and said to them, “Won’t you show me which of us is for the king of Israel?”
verses.ct: This infuriated the king of Syria. He summoned his officers and demanded, "Tell me! Which one of you is leaking information to the king of Israel?"

verses.kjv: And one of his servants said, None, my lord, O king: but Elisha, the prophet that is in Israel, telleth the king of Israel the words that thou speakest in thy bedchamber.
verses.web: One of his servants said, “No, my lord, O king; but Elisha, the prophet who is in Israel, tells the king of Israel the words that you speak in your bedroom.”
verses.ct: One of his officers said, "None of us, my lord. It's Elisha, the prophet in Israel. He tells the king of Israel the very words you speak in your own bedroom."

verses.kjv: And he said, Go and spy where he is, that I may send and fetch him. And it was told him, saying, Behold, he is in Dothan.
verses.web: He said, “Go and see where he is, that I may send and get him.” He was told, “Behold, he is in Dothan.”
verses.ct: The king ordered, "Go find out where he is so I can send men to capture him." The report came back: "He's in Dothan."

verses.kjv: Therefore sent he thither horses, and chariots, and a great host: and they came by night, and compassed the city about.
verses.web: Therefore he sent horses, chariots, and a great army there. They came by night, and surrounded the city.
verses.ct: So the king sent horses, chariots, and a massive army. They arrived at night and surrounded the city.

verses.kjv: And when the servant of the man of God was risen early, and gone forth, behold, an host compassed the city both with horses and chariots. And his servant said unto him, Alas, my master! how shall we do?
verses.web: When the servant of the man of God had risen early, and gone out, behold, an army with horses and chariots was around the city. His servant said to him, “Alas, my master! What shall we do?”
verses.ct: Early the next morning, Elisha's servant went outside and saw the army with horses and chariots encircling the city. He rushed back and cried, "Master, what are we going to do?"

verses.kjv: And he answered, Fear not: for they that be with us are more than they that be with them.
verses.web: He answered, “Don’t be afraid; for those who are with us are more than those who are with them.”
verses.ct: Elisha answered, "Don't be afraid. Those who are with us outnumber those who are with them."

verses.kjv: And Elisha prayed, and said, LORD, I pray thee, open his eyes, that he may see. And the LORD opened the eyes of the young man; and he saw: and, behold, the mountain was full of horses and chariots of fire round about Elisha.
verses.web: Elisha prayed, and said, “LORD, please open his eyes, that he may see.” LORD opened the young man’s eyes; and he saw: and behold, the mountain was full of horses and chariots of fire around Elisha.
verses.ct: Then Elisha prayed, "LORD, please open his eyes so he can see." The LORD opened the young man's eyes, and he looked up — the hills were covered with horses and chariots of fire all around Elisha.

verses.kjv: And when they came down to him, Elisha prayed unto the LORD, and said, Smite this people, I pray thee, with blindness. And he smote them with blindness according to the word of Elisha.
verses.web: When they came down to him, Elisha prayed to LORD, and said, “Please strike this people with blindness.” He struck them with blindness according to Elishah’s word.
verses.ct: As the Syrian army advanced toward him, Elisha prayed to the LORD, "Strike these soldiers with blindness." And the LORD struck them blind, just as Elisha had asked.

verses.kjv: And Elisha said unto them, This is not the way, neither is this the city: follow me, and I will bring you to the man whom ye seek. But he led them to Samaria.
verses.web: Elisha said to them, “This is not the way, neither is this the city. Follow me, and I will bring you to the man whom you seek.” He led them to Samaria.
verses.ct: Then Elisha told them, "This isn't the right road, and this isn't the right city. Follow me, and I'll take you to the man you're looking for." But he led them straight to Samaria.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when they were come into Samaria, that Elisha said, LORD, open the eyes of these men, that they may see. And the LORD opened their eyes, and they saw; and, behold, they were in the midst of Samaria.
verses.web: When they had come into Samaria, Elisha said, “LORD, open these men’s eyes, that they may see.” LORD opened their eyes, and they saw; and behold, they were in the middle of Samaria.
verses.ct: Once they were inside Samaria, Elisha prayed, "LORD, open their eyes so they can see." The LORD opened their eyes, and they realized they were standing in the middle of Samaria.

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel said unto Elisha, when he saw them, My father, shall I smite them? shall I smite them?
verses.web: The king of Israel said to Elisha, when he saw them, “My father, shall I strike them? Shall I strike them?”
verses.ct: When the king of Israel saw them, he asked Elisha eagerly, "Should I kill them, my father? Should I kill them?"

verses.kjv: And he answered, Thou shalt not smite them: wouldest thou smite those whom thou hast taken captive with thy sword and with thy bow? set bread and water before them, that they may eat and drink, and go to their master.
verses.web: He answered, “You shall not strike them. Would you strike those whom you have taken captive with your sword and with your bow? Set bread and water before them, that they may eat and drink, and go to their master.”
verses.ct: "No, don't kill them," Elisha answered. "Would you execute prisoners you captured with your own sword and bow? Give them food and water. Let them eat and drink, and then send them back to their master."

verses.kjv: And he prepared great provision for them: and when they had eaten and drunk, he sent them away, and they went to their master. So the bands of Syria came no more into the land of Israel.
verses.web: He prepared a great feast for them. When they had eaten and drunk, he sent them away, and they went to their master. So the bands of Syria stopped raiding the land of Israel.
verses.ct: So the king prepared a huge feast for them. After they had eaten and drunk their fill, he sent them on their way back to their master. From then on, the Syrian raiding parties stopped invading Israel.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after this, that Benhadad king of Syria gathered all his host, and went up, and besieged Samaria.
verses.web: After this, Benhadad king of Syria gathered all his army, and went up and besieged Samaria.
verses.ct: Some time later, King Benhadad of Syria assembled his entire army, marched against Samaria, and laid siege to it.

verses.kjv: And there was a great famine in Samaria: and, behold, they besieged it, until an ass’s head was sold for fourscore pieces of silver, and the fourth part of a cab of dove’s dung for five pieces of silver.
verses.web: There was a great famine in Samaria. Behold, they besieged it, until a donkey’s head was sold for eighty pieces of silver, and the fourth part of a kab of dove’s dung for five pieces of silver.
verses.ct: The siege caused a terrible famine in Samaria. It got so bad that a donkey's head sold for 80 pieces of silver, and a quarter of a kab of dove's dung went for 5 pieces of silver.

verses.kjv: And as the king of Israel was passing by upon the wall, there cried a woman unto him, saying, Help, my lord, O king.
verses.web: As the king of Israel was passing by on the wall, a woman cried to him, saying, “Help, my lord, O king!”
verses.ct: One day, as the king of Israel was walking along the city wall, a woman cried out to him, "Help me, my lord the king!"

verses.kjv: And he said, If the LORD do not help thee, whence shall I help thee? out of the barnfloor, or out of the winepress?
verses.web: He said, “If LORD doesn’t help you, where could I get help for you? From of the threshing floor, or from the wine press?”
verses.ct: He replied, "If the LORD won't help you, how can I? Do I have grain from a threshing floor or wine from a winepress to give you?"

verses.kjv: And the king said unto her, What aileth thee? And she answered, This woman said unto me, Give thy son, that we may eat him to day, and we will eat my son to morrow.
verses.web: The king said to her, “What is your problem?” She answered, “This woman said to me, ‘Give your son, that we may eat him today, and we will eat my son tomorrow.’
verses.ct: Then the king asked, "What's wrong?" She answered, "This woman made a deal with me: 'Give up your son so we can eat him today, and tomorrow we'll eat my son.'"

verses.kjv: So we boiled my son, and did eat him: and I said unto her on the next day, Give thy son, that we may eat him: and she hath hid her son.
verses.web: So we boiled my son, and ate him: and I said to her on the next day, ‘Give your son, that we may eat him;’ and she has hidden her son.”
verses.ct: "So we boiled my son and ate him. The next day I said to her, 'Now give up your son so we can eat him,' but she has hidden her son."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the king heard the words of the woman, that he rent his clothes; and he passed by upon the wall, and the people looked, and, behold, he had sackcloth within upon his flesh.
verses.web: When the king heard the words of the woman, he tore his clothes. Now he was passing by on the wall, and the people looked, and behold, he had sackcloth underneath on his body.
verses.ct: When the king heard the woman's words, he tore his clothes in anguish. As he continued along the wall, the people could see that underneath his royal garments, he was wearing sackcloth against his skin.

verses.kjv: Then he said, God do so and more also to me, if the head of Elisha the son of Shaphat shall stand on him this day.
verses.web: Then he said, “God do so to me, and more also, if the head of Elisha the son of Shaphat stays on him today.”
verses.ct: He declared, "May God strike me dead and worse if Elisha son of Shaphat still has his head on his shoulders by the end of this day!"

verses.kjv: But Elisha sat in his house, and the elders sat with him; and the king sent a man from before him: but ere the messenger came to him, he said to the elders, See ye how this son of a murderer hath sent to take away mine head? look, when the messenger cometh, shut the door, and hold him fast at the door: is not the sound of his master’s feet behind him?
verses.web: But Elisha was sitting in his house, and the elders were sitting with him. Then the king sent a man from before him; but before the messenger came to him, he said to the elders, “Do you see how this son of a murderer has sent to take away my head? Behold, when the messenger comes, shut the door, and hold the door shut against him. Isn’t the sound of his master’s feet behind him?”
verses.ct: Meanwhile, Elisha was sitting in his house with the elders. The king had sent a messenger ahead, but before the man arrived, Elisha told the elders, "Do you see what this son of a murderer is doing? He's sent someone to cut off my head! When the messenger gets here, shut the door and hold it against him. His master's footsteps are right behind him."

verses.kjv: And while he yet talked with them, behold, the messenger came down unto him: and he said, Behold, this evil is of the LORD; what should I wait for the LORD any longer?
verses.web: While he was still talking with them, behold, the messenger came down to him. Then he said, “Behold, this evil is from LORD. Why should I wait for LORD any longer?”
verses.ct: While Elisha was still speaking, the messenger arrived. Then the king himself said, "This disaster is from the LORD. Why should I wait for the LORD any longer?"
